intro: [WRONG START] Grewia rabehevitrai, commonly known as the Madagascar sourfig, is a small shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and endemic status.
